summary: This bill, H.R. 4582, amends the Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 and Title 5 of the United States Code to clarify that organ donation surgery qualifies as a serious health condition. This applies to both private sector and federal civil service employees, ensuring they can take leave for recovery related to organ donation. The bill also specifies how leave taken for organ donation interacts with existing leave provisions for federal employees serving as organ donors.
